trigger_event: Amid growing unrest and mass teacher-led assemblies, Nikola receives a personal note from a trusted intermediary, urging him to decide whether to open the BCI archives—or erase them forever.
dilemma: Nikola must choose between authorizing a full release of all BCI decision archives to the public, exposing years of manipulation, or approving a system-wide reset to erase all sensitive data and scores, preventing disclosure but erasing decades of records.
reason: He is deeply torn—Alex, the bartender, has reminded him how truth can heal but also destroy, and Nikola fears that either radical transparency or erasure could push Stenograd to chaos. His position gives him the access and credibility to execute either choice, and both carry risk of citywide upheaval or hope.
choice_a: Authorizes the full public release of BCI archives, trusting teacher-citizen assemblies to handle the truth, even as it means exposing painful secrets and igniting outrage.
belief_a: Real justice demands open acknowledgment of past wrongdoing.
Communities need the truth to forge new trust and healing.
Personal responsibility outweighs convenience or secrecy.
choice_b: Quietly authorizes a complete BCI data reset, deleting all personal histories to prevent unrest, but sacrificing both evidence and past.
belief_b: Order and stability must be prioritized, even at the cost of erasing history.
Old wounds are best left buried if peace can be preserved.
Swift, decisive action can stop a spiral into violence.
